<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// These nodes match the semantics of the corresponding RVV vector reduction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instructions. They produce a vector result which is the reduction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// performed over the second vector operand plus the first element of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// third vector operand. The first operand is the pass-thru operand. The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// second operand is an unconstrained vector type, and the result, first, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// third operand&#39;s types are expected to be the corresponding full-width</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LMUL=1 type for the second operand:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   nxv8i8 = vecreduce&#95;add nxv8i8, nxv32i8, nxv8i8</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   nxv2i32 = vecreduce&#95;add nxv2i32, nxv8i32, nxv2i32</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The different in types does introduce extra vsetvli instructions but</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if the given shuffle mask can be codegen&#39;d directly, or if it</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// should be stack expanded.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvtargetlowering/#aa9f61dd4cf5e9bdff7ab3e0ccd9b49e1">isShuffleMaskLegal</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;int&gt;</a> M, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt">EVT</a> VT) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const override</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvtargetlowering/#ae48d974556a4a4ac56f2ce1f5ba11586"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvtargetlowering/#ae48d974556a4a4ac56f2ce1f5ba11586">isMultiStoresCheaperThanBitsMerge</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt">EVT</a> LTy, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt">EVT</a> HTy)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const override </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the pair to store is a mixture of float and int values, we will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// save two bitwise instructions and one float-to-int instruction and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// increase one store instruction. There is potentially a more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// significant benefit because it avoids the float-&gt;int domain switch</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for input value. So It is more likely a win.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ((LTy.isFloatingPoint() &amp;&amp; HTy.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#af975bf04c49cc895cfe38e7dc126a2f1">isInteger</a>()) ||</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlight">        (LTy.isInteger() &amp;&amp; HTy.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/evt/#a3cb888a2ce8e95e0d9769687a5e2f7d8">isFloatingPoint</a>()))</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the pair only contains int values, we will save two bitwise</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instructions and increase one store instruction (costing one more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// store buffer). Since the benefit is more blurred we leave such a pair</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00597" /><CodeLine lineNumber="597"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// out until we get testcase to prove it is a win.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00598" /><CodeLine lineNumber="598"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00599" /><CodeLine lineNumber="599"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00603" /><CodeLine lineNumber="603"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> DefinedValues) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const override</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00827" /><CodeLine lineNumber="827" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvtargetlowering/#a54c86dae4e6241448405b7986685565b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">inline</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/riscvtargetlowering/#a54c86dae4e6241448405b7986685565b">computeVLMAX</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> VectorBits, </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> EltSize,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                      </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MinSize) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00829" /><CodeLine lineNumber="829"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Original equation:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00830" /><CodeLine lineNumber="830"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   VLMAX = (VectorBits / EltSize) &#42; LMUL</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00831" /><CodeLine lineNumber="831"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   where LMUL = MinSize / RISCV::RVVBitsPerBlock</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The following equations have been reordered to prevent loss of precision</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// when calculating fractional LMUL.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ((VectorBits / EltSize) &#42; MinSize) / <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/riscv/#ad53ed145f88b1e1c966ff68df9029e7f">RISCV::RVVBitsPerBlock</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Return inclusive (low, high) bounds on the value of VLMAX for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// given scalable container type given known bounds on VLEN.</span></CodeLine>
